{
 "cells": [
  {
   "cell_type": "markdown",
   "metadata": {},
   "source": [
    "# Prepare the environment"
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "code",
   "execution_count": 9,
   "metadata": {
    "tags": [
     "hide-cell"
    ]
   },
   "outputs": [],
   "source": [
    "from matplotlib import rcParams\n",
    "\n",
    "rcParams[\"savefig.dpi\"] = 120\n",
    "rcParams[\"figure.dpi\"] = 120\n",
    "#rcParams[\"font.size\"] = 20"
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "markdown",
   "metadata": {},
   "source": [
    "In the following tutorial, we will use **pyodine** to compute RVs from SONG spectra for the star !!!!XYZ!!!! This includes three basic steps:\n",
    "\n",
    "- using I2-free observations of the star, plus B-star spectra *with* the I2 cell, to :doc:`create a deconvolved stellar template <template>`;\n",
    "\n",
    "- with that template, :doc:`modelling the I2 observations <observation>` of the star to arrive at best-fit parameters (including, most importantly, the chunk velocities);\n",
    "\n",
    "- :doc:`weighting and combining the chunk velocities <velocities>` to compute the RV timeseries of the observations.\n",
    "\n",
    "In each of these steps, we will present how to use built-in methods of **pyodine** to visualize and analyze the results.\n",
    "\n",
    "\n",
    "But, first of all, we need to prepare everything.\n",
    "\n",
    "One possibility to use **pyodine** from any location in your filesystem is by appending its root path to the Python system path, and then importing like this:"
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "code",
   "execution_count": 2,
   "metadata": {},
   "outputs": [],
   "source": [
    "import sys\n",
    "\n",
    "sys.path.append('/home/paul/pyodine/')\n",
    "\n",
    "import pyodine"
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "markdown",
   "metadata": {},
   "source": [
    "In the following, we will use some capabilities of **pyodine** to examine the I2 atlas and the utilities module."
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "markdown",
   "metadata": {},
   "source": [
    "## The I2 atlas"
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "markdown",
   "metadata": {},
   "source": [
    "-> if you have your own, bring it into the correct hdf5-format (find out more about `HDF5/h5py <http://www.h5py.org/>`_)\n",
    "\n",
    "-> here, we just use the one by SONG\n",
    "\n",
    "We use functions contained in `pyodine.lib.h5quick` to print information about the I2 atlas: `h5print` to show the structure of the HDF5 file/h5py object, and `h5data` to load the wavelength and flux vectors needed in the later modelling."
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "code",
   "execution_count": 12,
   "metadata": {},
   "outputs": [
    {
     "name": "stdout",
     "output_type": "stream",
     "text": [
      "/\n",
      "└ flux\n",
      "└ flux_normalized\n",
      "└ wavelength\n",
      "└ wavelength_air\n",
      "└ wavenumber\n",
      "\n",
      "Length of the wavelength/flux vectors: 618003\n",
      "\\\\nFull wavelength range (air): 4988.607249459516 - 6498.199513520377 $\\AA$\n"
     ]
    }
   ],
   "source": [
    "from pyodine.lib.h5quick import h5print, h5data\n",
    "\n",
    "I2_path = '/home/paul/data_lick/iodine_atlas/song_iodine_cell_01_65C.h5'\n",
    "\n",
    "h = h5py.File(I2_path, 'r')\n",
    "h5print(h)\n",
    "\n",
    "flux_normalized = h5data(h['flux_normalized'])\n",
    "wavelength_air  = h5data(h['wavelength_air'])\n",
    "\n",
    "print('\\nLength of the wavelength/flux vectors:', len(wavelength_air))\n",
    "print('\\nFull wavelength range (air): {} - {} Angstrom'.format(wavelength_air[0], wavelength_air[-1]))"
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "markdown",
   "metadata": {},
   "source": [
    "As you can see, the I2 atlas contains the wavelength range between roughly 4989 and 6498 Å."
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "code",
   "execution_count": 13,
   "metadata": {},
   "outputs": [
    {
     "data": {
      "text/plain": [
       "Text(0, 0.5, 'Norm. flux')"
      ]
     },
     "execution_count": 13,
     "metadata": {},
     "output_type": "execute_result"
    },
    {
     "data": {
      "image/png": "\n",
      "text/plain": [
       "<Figure size 720x480 with 2 Axes>"
      ]
     },
     "metadata": {
      "needs_background": "light"
     },
     "output_type": "display_data"
    }
   ],
   "source": [
    "import matplotlib.pyplot as plt\n",
    "import numpy as np\n",
    "\n",
    "ind = np.where(np.logical_and(wavelength_air>5500., wavelength_air<5505.))\n",
    "\n",
    "fig, axs = plt.subplots(2)\n",
    "axs[0].set_title('I2 atlas')\n",
    "axs[0].plot(wavelength_air, flux_normalized, alpha=0.7)\n",
    "axs[1].plot(wavelength_air[ind], flux_normalized[ind], alpha=0.7)\n",
    "axs[1].set_xlabel(r'Wavelength [$\\AA$]')\n",
    "axs[0].set_ylabel('Norm. flux')\n",
    "axs[1].set_ylabel('Norm. flux')"
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "markdown",
   "metadata": {},
   "source": [
    "## The utilities module"
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "markdown",
   "metadata": {},
   "source": [
    "-> prepare all instrument-specific code, such as I/O of spectra, modelling parameters etc.\n",
    "\n",
    "-> again, we just use the existing ``utilities_song`` module"
   ]
  },
